label: [NodeDev] Node-RED nodes for the development of Node-RED nodes in Node-RED
info:
::: aim

Development of basic node within Node-RED.

:::


::: requirements

- [development node flow](https://flowhub.org/f/d0506e991d512ace)

:::

::: explanation

This flow creates the NodeDev nodes that make it easier to develop nodes within Node-RED, i.e., Node-RED nodes can be developed in Node-RED using Node-RED nodes.

The flow, by using random package names, does not require that Node-RED be restarted. The only thing to do between successive installation of a package is to reload the browser window.

That is if `randompackagename` is set and this should not be set once a package is published to NPMjs.com.

:::

name: import existing tgz and transform them into PkgFiles
randomise package name for quicker local development

name: README.md
template:
## Node-RED node development in Node-RED

These nodes support the development of nodes in Node-RED by providing a framework for creating tar-balls which can be submitted to NPMjs.com

But also these nodes allow for local installation of nodes to test within Node-RED. If done correnctly, no restart of Node-RED is required, only reloading of the editor.

These nodes are maintained by this [flow](https://flowhub.org/f/b92be5062203ff69) and any pull requests here will be integrated there.


### Examples 

Examples are included, all of which require the installation of the [instrospection](https://flows.nodered.org/node/@gregoriusrippenstein/node-red-contrib-introspection) node package:

- Convertining an existing tar-gzip package file into a collection of PkgFiles for testing and maintaince and development
- NodeFactory example of creating a boilerplate node for inclusion in a node collection

name: package.json
npm-tarball.html
npm-tarball.js
package dir structure
func:
msg.contents = [
    { name: 'LICENSE',                        contents: msg.contents.license },
    { name: 'README.md',                      contents: msg.contents.readme_md },
    { name: 'package.json',                   contents: msg.contents.package_json},

    { name: 'nodes/10-node-factory.html',     contents: msg.contents.node_factory_html },
    { name: 'nodes/10-node-factory.js',       contents: msg.contents.node_factory_js },
    { name: 'nodes/20-pkg-file.html',         contents: msg.contents.pkg_file_html },
    { name: 'nodes/20-pkg-file.js',           contents: msg.contents.pkg_file_js },
    { name: 'nodes/30-npm-tarball.html',      contents: msg.contents.npm_tarball_html},
    { name: 'nodes/30-npm-tarball.js',        contents: msg.contents.npm_tarball_js},
    { name: 'nodes/40-node-red-install.html', contents: msg.contents.node_red_install_html},
    { name: 'nodes/40-node-red-install.js',   contents: msg.contents.node_red_install_js},
    { name: 'nodes/50-npm-publish.js',        contents: msg.contents.npm_publish_js },
    { name: 'nodes/50-npm-publish.html',      contents: msg.contents.npm_publish_html },

    { name: 'examples/convert-existing-tgz.json',          contents: msg.contents.example_convert_existing_tgz },
    { name: 'examples/factory-generate-example-node.json', contents: msg.contents.example_factory_generate_example_node },

    { name: 'nodes/templates/tmpl.js',   contents: msg.contents.templateJS },
    { name: 'nodes/templates/tmpl.html', contents: msg.contents.templateHTML },
]

return msg;
